text:
I try to use ant api: zip in org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs package to produce .zip file, and I found that if the directory to compress is about 10+GB the result zip file is corrupted, otherwise it works OK.
I tried this many times on Windows XP and Windows Server 2003, it's always same. Why?
creator: charles-xie@hotmail.com
bodewig@apache.org
text:
I'm not sure what a directory of more than 10 GB could be.

The version of the ZIP "standard" implemented by Ant's zip package doesn't allow a single file to be bigger than 2 GB.  Bigger files are only supported in ZIP version 3 and above, see bug 45429.

(In reply to comment #1)
> I'm not sure what a directory of more than 10 GB could be.
> The version of the ZIP "standard" implemented by Ant's zip package doesn't
> allow a single file to be bigger than 2 GB.  Bigger files are only supported in
> ZIP version 3 and above, see bug 45429.

The directory I tested is in Lotus Domino: /Domino/Data/mail. There is about 1000 users in Lotus Domino Server, so this directory could be more than 10GB. The purpose is to backup it. :)
creator: charles-xie@hotmail.com
bodewig@apache.org
